item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 29, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple Photos phones home on iOS 18 and macOS 15 (532 points | 415 comments)
2. Intel's $475M error: the silicon behind the Pentium division bug (188 points | 49 comments)
3. WebGL Fluid Simulation (8 points | 5 comments)
4. Personal Mail Server on OpenBSD (2019) (46 points | 29 comments)
5. Bad keming: Kerning failures, plus other typographical and font mishaps (12 points | 4 comments)
6. Fish 4.0: The Fish of Theseus (463 points | 74 comments)
7. Can LLMs Accurately Recall the Bible (21 points | 8 comments)
8. EmacsConf 2024 Notes (261 points | 75 comments)
9. NASA, Axiom Space Change Assembly Order of Commercial Space Station (61 points | 17 comments)
10. Where can you go in Europe by train in 8h? (414 points | 307 comments)
11. Hello World on z/OS (2018) (6 points | 3 comments)
12. I automated my job application process (344 points | 531 comments)
13. Show HN: Anki AI Utils (97 points | 12 comments)
14. The Gambler Who Cracked the Horse-Racing Code (2018) (89 points | 38 comments)
15. Jeju Air accident in South Korea kills at least 47 (106 points | 98 comments)
16. Finding and exploiting hidden features of Animal Crossing's NES emulator (2018) (58 points | 2 comments)
17. Astronauts face unique visual challenges at lunar South Pole (20 points | 9 comments)
18. Show HN: Resizer2 – i3/KDE window movement on Windows (21 points | 8 comments)
19. Joco almost died at launch. Now, it's a lifeline for e-bike delivery riders (65 points | 25 comments)
20. So you want to write Java in Neovim (136 points | 116 comments)
21. My history with Forth and stack machines (2010) (86 points | 24 comments)
22. Carlsen disqualified from World Rapid and Blitz championship for wearing jeans (255 points | 317 comments)
23. Guide to mechanical keyboards (83 points | 103 comments)
24. EU law mandating universal chargers for devices comes into force (164 points | 141 comments)
25. Numbers Are Leaves (191 points | 57 comments)
26. Libero – A Programmer's Tool and Code Generator (1997) (35 points | 9 comments)
27. 38C3: Blinkencity, radio controlling street lamps and power plants [video] (34 points | 5 comments)
28. $250 remaining of L&D budget – what to spend on? (8 points | 7 comments)
29. Family of OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji demand FBI investigate death (201 points | 68 comments)
30. Building a 3D safety sensor with Rust (83 points | 18 comments)
